sn40.8:0.3: 8. A Question About the Dimension of Neither Perception Nor Non-Perception
sn40.8:1.1: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of neither perception nor non-perception’.
sn40.8:1.2: What is the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception?
sn40.8:1.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, enters and remains in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:1.5: This is called the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
sn40.8:1.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:1.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of nothingness beset me.
sn40.8:2.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
sn40.8:2.3: Don’t neglect the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; unify your mind and immerse it in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
sn40.8:2.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:2.5: So if anyone should be rightly called a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
